articles.title: Tennis Serve Fundamentals
articles.text: The tennis serve is one of the most important shots in tennis. The key elements of a good serve include: proper grip (continental), ball toss consistency, knee bend for power, and follow-through. Common mistakes include incorrect grip position, poor ball toss, and lack of proper weight transfer.

articles.title: Choosing the Right Tennis Racket
articles.text: Selecting a tennis racket depends on several factors: player level, playing style, and physical attributes. Key specifications include head size (95-110 sq inches), weight (250-330g), balance point, and string pattern. Beginners should generally start with lighter rackets with larger head sizes for more power and forgiveness.

articles.title: Tennis Scoring System
articles.text: Tennis scoring proceeds as follows: points are scored as 0 (Love), 15, 30, 40, and game. Players must win by two clear points. A set is won when a player wins six games with a two-game advantage. In professional tennis, matches are typically best of three or five sets.
